comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content: Could this be No.18 the second of the "E-17" class 0-6-0 freight locomotives, built in 1866 by Robert Stephenson & Co in Newcastle as their Builder's Number 1542. It was restored and placed on display at the Enfield Roundhouse site, and transferred to Thirlmere together with other exhibits in 1975. www.australiansteam.com/18.htm investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp...

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/73199923@N00] The last of its class to survive, No 18 was used at Corrimal Coke and Coal Company until 1953 (having been in service for 88 years!) and you're right the locomotive is now preserved at the Rail Transport Museum at Thirlmere. Thus the date of the photograph is, I suspect sometime in the mid to late-fifties.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper/5340734003/in/set-72157625787889006]

E-18 at the Rail Transport Museum

However, the locomotive placed on display at Enfield was No 78 - and it too is now on display at the Rail Transport Museum.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper/5490927217/in/set-72157625787889006]

No 78 at Enfield

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper/5492331179/in/set-72157625787889006]

No 78 before going on display at the Rail Heritage Centre in January 2011

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/grahamh_pix] No 18 came to the RTM  in 1964 and No 78 arrived in 1975.

Shortly after arriving No 78 was put on display with a 'borrowed' 24 class tender

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/60790501@N04/5780078241/]
